Kursk front of the Russo-Ukrainian war was opened when Ukraine  launched an offensive into Russia's Kursk oblast on 8 August 2024. After Russia retook Sudzha on 13 March 2025 and the bulk of Ukrainian forces retreated from Kursk Oblast, clashes continued in the region as some units of the Ukrainian Armed Forces remained on Russian territory, operating also in Belgorod Oblast since 18 March.
Background
On 24 February 2022, Russia invaded Ukraine, starting the largest and deadliest war in Europe since World War II, in a major escalation of the conflict between the two countries which began in 2014.
